items.title: Israel's budget deficit jumps 33 pct in Oct.
items.summary: JERUSALEM, Nov. 10 (Xinhua) -- Israel's budget deficit in October reached 15.3 billion shekels (around 4.7 billion U.S. dollars), up from 11.5 billion shekels in October last year, a year-on-year rise of 33 percent, according to a report issued by the state's Ministry of Finance on Monday. Read full story

items.title: Save a rare $149 on Husqvarna’s Power Axe 350i 18-inch cordless chainsaw with a 7.5Ah battery at a $330 annual low
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Husqvarna Power Axe 350i 40V 18-inch Cordless Electric Chainsaw with 7.5Ah battery at $329.99 shipped. It’s coming down from $479 here, with discounts over 2025 having kept the costs above $383 until last month’s Prime Day event, when it fell lower to $369. Today’s deal goes even lower thanks to the total $149 cut from the going rate, landing it at the best price of the year and the second-best price overall – just $12 above the low we last saw in October 2024. There’s a few other electric tools from the brand seeing discounts that you can browse in the brand’s official Amazon storefront here.

items.title: Lectric’s XP4 e-bikes get best bundles of up to $514 in FREE gear for Black Friday Singles’ Day starting from $999
items.summary:
As part of its early Black Friday Sale, which also includes the 25% off Battery Sale, we wanted to shine a spotlight on Lectric’s XP4 e-bikes with up to $514 FREE bundle packages, which also coincides for Singles’ Day. You can hop aboard the standard XP4 Folding Utility e-bike with $326 in FREE gear at $999 shipped, while the XP4 750 Long-Range Folding Utility e-bike gets $514 in FREE gear at $1,299 shipped. These packages would normally run $1,325 and $1,813 were it not for the discounts on the bundles themselves. The long-range 750 models are offering a second chance at the largest bundles that we first saw during the brand’s Spooky Sale last month, while the standard models are getting an increase to the largest bundles to date over the usual $79 packages we’ve been seeing since the series’ release in May.
